text: Does anyone use a Local environment to build there HubSpot sites?
I’m trying to, It’s so far been a pain to be totally honest. local HubL server / FTP needs some work imho
I want to set up a local environment for the company im at for the sites.
I do it mostly locally, but I can be a pain like Ben said.

I’ve heard there are updates to the FTP in the pipeline but my main issue is around building out custom modules in local hubl which i’m being told is not supported.  The other problems are around the use of like global parts being put in places you can’t find on the FTP along with importing site settings you have set up locally to a portal within HubSpot neither, to my knowledge work.
Yeah building out custom modules isn't directly support ATM
you can tho, use the API to push it
Well yes, we do that here. It just requires knowledge of the API. Let me rephrase, building out custom modules isn't support via FTP

Feedback on the new nav: it’d be great in the account switcher if there was a search field, to search different accounts.

We have over a hundred accounts… makes scrolling through that list a lot of work
^ Amen
^ ^ Amen

Any idea what would cause an embedded form to (sometimes) blow out of all of its wrappers and hang out at the end of the DOM?
<https://www.aventri.com/>
Is it chaotic neutral?
The form embed script is at the bottom of the page, so my guess would be that the form is loading before its target exists, or something
Okay nevermind, I was just talking about if you used the form module, this looks like a plopped-in embed code
That was my feeling too but I haven’t had to do any timeout stuff with other embedded forms.
Assuming I'm looking at the right form
it can happen if you don’t have a target set in the embed code
Yeah I think you are <@U3A4KEWK1> it’s that subscribe form in the footer. I’ll try that out <@U26H0JQ05> thanks!

I’m still getting to grips with the API for this stuff but so far i’ve only had what Gonzalo has told me, if you know of a guide on this in getting the local module to work as well as then pushing it to HS and it working there i’d be really interested in how you guys have it setup.

Exciting news <!here> :hugging_face::hugging_face::hugging_face: I have a limited number of <#CBF8XQ57U|> community passes *SPECIFICALLY* for Developers (not marketers). Community passes are required to attend the "Partner Day @ INBOUND" event where we are hosting:
> - x3 developer-specific tracks (~11 developer sessions total) :nerd_face:
> - Community Developer Science Fair. :robot_face:
We will also be hosting "Developer Open Office" periodically throughout the week at the actual INBOUND event.

:point_right::point_right:If you have developers on your team who want to attend, but need a ticket.... direct message me. (limited - first come, first serve)
hoping this is a valuable enough offer to warrant an @ here mention :stuck_out_tongue:. If not, sorry to bug ya! :pray:

noticing the same issue as <@U26DA9CQ0> regarding embedded forms getting appended to the end of the page. I know <@U6GNQ7JBU> said yesterday this was an issue with forms using the name of their parent container when one or more forms and that a fix was pushed. Do all embedded forms now need to reference a specific target because of this code change? Haven’t seen this happen before but just fixed one by adding a target to it. this seems like a big change to embedded form behavior.
just checked a different site and am seeing the behavior i’d expect where the form is rendered below its embed script. not sure why this is different between the two
The only thing I've done to combat that is use the embed code and target. I'm not sure WHY it happens and I can't figure it out
I had never seen it before either, it was also working for the last few weeks <@U5BGUA4BX> . I fixed it by adding a target but then the markup changed and I had to fix the styling.
I've seen this happen in December of last year

yeah, I would like to not have to go through all of our old sites and add a target to any embedded forms we’ve used, as utilizing embeds is a pretty common way for us to get more mileage out of our custom modules. the target is listed as an optional parameter, encouraged if more than one form, and this is happening on pages with only one form. i also can’t see a difference between the way our affected site is utilizing them vs. the non-affected one.

any word from HS in December, <@U25PYL3Q8>? or did you manually add all the targets?
hm just noticed on the site I thought was unaffected, some are affected while others aren’t.
I think it is random. I think it is an issue in the way the javascript loads the form
I think it can happen to all sites, however I feel it is mostly going to happen when you are constantly refreshing a site
Nothing from HS when I sent in the message, they just told me try targeting.

that’s extremely frustrating. we have marketers familiar enough with the platform to add embeds to modules we build, and when copying the embed code it states “To embed ‘NAME’ form on your website, copy and paste the code below into the HTML code for your website where you’d like it to appear.” - so that behavior is not matching up with the instructions it gives.
but thanks for the insight, Nick. <@U22PU4G4A> <@U22PJPGK0> <@U6GNQ7JBU> can I have one of your eyes on why this behavior is different or point me to a HS dev who can help?
<@U22PKFRU5> <@U22PNRAJD> <@U26B530N6>? anyone able to help with the above? seeing the same forms behave differently between the preview iframe and the live pages.
